title: How are drones currently being used in public works projects? - Quora

response.answer_text: The most common use that I’m aware of is inspection. Because of the low cost of drones and the high quality cameras they carry, they are being used for this quite a lot. They allow for visual inspection of hard to reach areas like towers, dams, and bridges much more safely than climbing, and more cost effectively than bringing in a lift or scaffolding. They are also used in cases where a “bird’s eye view” is useful. Getting an overall view of how a crop is faring is something I’ve seen. Areas where plants are doing poorly can be seen that one would miss from the ground.

In civil engineering and construction it’s used to scan imagery that’s used for creating 3D models. Once the models are created there’s a lot of useful applications. For example the construction companies can monitor the progress of the project, or estimate the volume of material piles, or inspect hard to get to places. Here’s a short video of Autodesk Recap that explains the Drone2Design process.  Here’s an example of using drones to inspect bridges and infrastructure with drones by the civil engineering department of Florida Tech. Researches Explore Drones as Bridge Inspection Tools
